introduction.hi: Hi, I'm Jay — a software engineer from Hong Kong, based in Tokyo, Japan.
introduction.ios: I build intuitive, user-friendly iOS applications using Swift and modern Apple frameworks, with a focus on creating smooth, elegant, and thoughtful user experiences.
introduction.web: Previously, I worked as a front-end web developer using React and TypeScript — a background that continues to shape how I think about structure, responsiveness, and design systems, now in the mobile space.
introduction.love: Beyond the screen, I'm someone who loves language, culture, and creativity.
introduction.language: I speak four languages — Cantonese, English, Mandarin and Japanese — and I enjoy working with people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds. It's part of what makes collaboration feel both meaningful and natural to me.
introduction.travel: I've also explored 13 countries and visited 33 of Japan's 47 prefectures, driven by a love for culture and curiosity.
introduction.music: In my spare time, I turn to music. I play the piano and bass, and I occasionally transcribe or arrange songs just for fun.

focus.cert: Studying for the Fundamental Information Technology Engineer Examination (基本情報技術者試験)
focus.japanese: Improving my Japanese for both daily life and professional fluency
focus.piano: Practicing piano regularly and arranging songs occasionally
focus.ios: Deepening my iOS development skills with Swift, SwiftUI, and UIKit
focus.web: Continuing to explore web development with Next.js to stay sharp with frontend trends

introduction.closing: I'm always open to new ideas and fun conversations — feel free to reach out!
